intro: Gnaphalium declinatum, commonly known as the bent willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, riverbanks, and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellowish-white. It is known for its ability to thrive in wet environments and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
